item.title: Predicting the NCAA Tournament Bracket using Machine Learning
item.description: library(reactable) library(tidyverse) ## ── Attaching packages ─────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse 1.3.0 ── ## ✓ ggplot2 3.3.3 ✓ purrr 0.3.4 ## ✓ tibble 3.0.6 ✓ dplyr 1.0.3 ## ✓ tidyr 1.1.2 ✓ stringr 1.4.0 ## ✓ readr 1.4.0 ✓ forcats 0.5.1 ## ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── ## x dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() ## x dplyr::lag() masks stats::lag() library(tidymodels) ## ── Attaching packages ────────────────────────────────────── tidymodels 0.1.2 ── ## ✓ broom 0.7.4 ✓ recipes 0.

item.title: How Predicting The NCAA Tournament with Machine Learning went Terribly Wrong
item.description: After only getting two games wrong in the B1G Tournament, I was sitting on top of the world. I thought I was a data genius and felt pretty confident going to the NCAA Tournament’s first round. After all, I got three out of the four of the First Four games correct. Then it all came crumbling down. In our class NCAA ESPN Tournament Challenge, I finished in 15th and only correctly predicted 14% of the games.
